channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, 8 June 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Teal to support International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month

June is Myasthenia Gravis awareness Month. The Myasthenia Gravis Association of Qld Inc., (MGAQ) was formed in 1991 and has been recognised by Queensland Health as the peak body for people with Myasthenia Gravis in Queensland. MGAQ uses this opportunity to raise awareness in the community of this little-known rare disease and support the local Myasthenia group.

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Big Freeze 11
item.description:
Monday, 9 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Big Freeze 11

Founded in 2014, FightMND was established with the purpose of finding effective treatments and ultimately a cure for Motor Neurone Disease
The Big Freeze 11 aims to shine a light on the battle being fought by thousands of people across Australia who are diagnosed with MND, as currently there are no viable treatments and no cure for MND. Part of the Big Freeze 11 , the Mini Freeze will be during the Brisbane Lions vs St Kilda game on Friday 14th of June. Lighting up monuments around the country in our Big Freeze Blue aims to fund essential research and eventually make MND a thing of the past, but also, its an incredible display of solidarity and support for those in the MND community who have died, been diagnosed, or are currently fighting their battle against the Beast.

This Light Up is organised by: Fight MND

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Go Green for EcoMarines
item.description:
Tuesday, 10 June 2025

City Hall will be lit Green to support Go Green for EcoMarines

Go Green for EcoMarines is a statewide, two week-long campaign to raise awareness and funds to support an education-based action program targeting a reduction in waste and pollution and promoting recycling and other sustainable living options.
EcoMarines Foundation is a leading not for profit organisation providing education to school students on the impacts of everyday activities on their local landscapes, water systems and downstream marine environments. EcoMarines also provides support to help them target pollution and other negative human impacts in their local area, protecting those environments and promoting a sustainable lifestyle.

This Light Up is organised by: Tangalooma EcoMarines Foundation

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Portugal National Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 10 June 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red, Yellow and Green to celebrate Portugal National Day

Portugal National Day - 10th June celebrates the contribution of the Portuguese community to Queensland, promotes portuguese culture and fosters stronger relations between Portugal and Queensland

This Light Up is organised by: Honarary Consulate of Portugal in Queensland

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Thank a First Responder Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 11 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Teal to support Thank a First Responder Day

Thank a First Responder Day, a Fortem Australia initiative, is a National Day of Appreciation for first responders and their families. Held annually on the second Wednesday in June, on this day we call on the community to show their appreciation to local first responders by simply saying 'thank you'. In 2025, Thank a First Responder Day will fall on Wednesday, 11 June and we will host events in recognition of first responders across the week.

This Light Up is organised by: Fortem Australia Ltd

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 127th Philippines Independence Day
item.description:
Thursday, 12 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate the 127th Philippines Independence Day

The Philippine Declaration of Independence was proclaimed on June 12th 1898. Today the Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Incorporated would like to reach out Brisbane and its Filipino-Australians, and all residents to join together to celebrate the Philippines 127th Independence Day

This Light Up is organised by: Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Inc

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Lipoedema Awareness Month

item.title: MS Brissie to the Bay
item.description:
Saturday, 14 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support MS Brissie to the Bay

JOIN THE ICONIC MS BRISSIE TO THE BAY!
Our ever-popular MS Brissie to the Bay ride is back on Sunday 15 June for its 35th year and we’d love you to be part of this life-changing movement!
Choose from four great courses, designed to give riders of all ages and fitness levels the chance to be part of this fantastic community event. There’s also a ‘Ride For All’ which takes place on static bikes at the Event Village.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Elder Abuse Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, 15 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support World Elder Abuse Awareness Day

World Elder Abuse Awareness Day was launched on June 15, 2006 by the International Network for the Prevention of Elder Abuse and the World Health Organization at the United Nations. WEAAD also supports the United Nations International Plan of Action that acknowledges the significance of elder abuse a as a public health and human rights issue.
World Elder Abuse Awareness Day provides an opportunity for communities around the world to promote a better understanding of abuse and neglect of older persons by raising awareness of the cultural, social, economic and demographic processes affecting elder abuse and neglect.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services and UnitingCare

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: NCWQ Celebrating 120 Years
item.description:
Monday, 16 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to celebrate 120 Years of NCWQ 

The National Council of Women of Queensland (NCWQ) is an umbrella organisation for thirty women’s organisations. We seek to raise awareness of the rights and responsibilities of members as citizens and encourages their participation in all aspects of community life.
The 120th Anniversary celebration is to acknowledge significant difference NCWQ has made with a theme of Celebrating Queensland Women’s Voices; the legacy, leadership and change. NCWQ was started on 15th June 1905.

This Light Up is organised by: The National Council of Women of QLD (NCWQ)

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Police Legacy Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 17 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support National Police Legacy Day

This year, on 17 June, we proudly mark a new tradition: the very first National Police Legacy Day.
For 54 years, Police Legacy organisations across Australia have provided support to police and their families. Through both heartbreak and healing. Now, we come together nationally to honour this legacy of care. It is also a day to recognise all those who serve in our police forces — and the families who uphold their memory with strength and pride.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Police Legacy Scheme

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: State of Origin - Game II Perth
item.description:
Wednesday, 18 June 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Maroon to support State of Origin - Game II Perth

Perth’s Optus Stadium will host the much-anticipated State of Origin Game II between the New South Wales 'Blues' and Queensland 'Maroons' on Wednesday, 18 June 2025.
State of Origin is one of Australian sport’s greatest rivalries where Queensland is looking for redemption in this years series.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: YRNA Fun Run
item.description:
Friday, 20 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support YRNA Fun Run

You Are Not Alone is a youth mental health charity dedicated to shining a light on youth mental health, through engagement with schools and community events. The annual YRNA Fun Run aims to shine a light on youth mental health and raise funds for awareness events in our local community. Our main goal is to empower young people to speak up and remind them they are not alone.

This Light Up is organised by: You Are Not Alone Australia Limited

item.title: Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
item.description:
Wednesday, 25 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
 

Migraine Australia is celebrating Migraine Awareness Month again this June with our ‘Give Migraine a Break’ campaign.
We start the month with ‘Burple Day’ on Friday June 6 where we ask everyone to dress in burgundy or purple for awareness of migraine.
Shades for Migraine is on Saturday June 21, an international day for migraine, we ask everyone to wear sunglasses, take a selfie and post it to socials, in support of people with migraine.

Migraine Australia is the only national patient advocacy organisation to support all Australians, through advocacy, information and support, led by people living with Migraine. We work to actively and demonstrably improve the quality of life and wellbeing of all Australians living with Migraine and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia

item.title: Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
item.description:
Wednesday, 25 June 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
 

Migraine Australia is celebrating Migraine Awareness Month again this June with our ‘Give Migraine a Break’ campaign.
We start the month with ‘Burple Day’ on Friday June 6 where we ask everyone to dress in burgundy or purple for awareness of migraine.
Shades for Migraine is on Saturday June 21, an international day for migraine, we ask everyone to wear sunglasses, take a selfie and post it to socials, in support of people with migraine.

Migraine Australia is the only national patient advocacy organisation to support all Australians, through advocacy, information and support, led by people living with Migraine. We work to actively and demonstrably improve the quality of life and wellbeing of all Australians living with Migraine and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia
